title: Revelation Chapter 21 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Revelation chapter 21 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Revelation Chapter 21 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Revelation Chapter 21.

questions.question: What did John see coming down from God out of heaven in Revelation 21:2?
options: The holy city, new Jerusalem
A great eagle
A shining star
A river of life
questions.correctAnswer: The holy city, new Jerusalem
questions.explanation: John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband (Revelation 21:2).

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:4, what will God wipe away from their eyes?
options: All tears
All sin
All darkness
All fear
questions.correctAnswer: All tears
questions.explanation: God will wipe away all tears from their eyes, and there shall be no more death, sorrow, crying, nor pain (Revelation 21:4).

questions.question: Who is described as the Alpha and Omega in Revelation 21:6?
options: The one who sat on the throne
The angel with the golden reed
John
The Lamb
questions.correctAnswer: The one who sat on the throne
questions.explanation: He who sat upon the throne said, 'I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end' (Revelation 21:6).

questions.question: In Revelation 21:8, which of the following is NOT listed as having their part in the lake of fire?
options: The fearful
The abominable
The merciful
The liars
questions.correctAnswer: The merciful
questions.explanation: The fearful, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, whoremongers, sorcerers, idolaters, and liars have their part in the lake of fire, but merciful is not mentioned (Revelation 21:8).

questions.question: How many gates did the holy city have according to Revelation 21:12?
options: Twelve
Seven
Ten
Four
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve
questions.explanation: The holy city had a great wall with twelve gates, each guarded by twelve angels and named after the twelve tribes of Israel (Revelation 21:12).

questions.question: What was the city measured with in Revelation 21:15?
options: A golden reed
A silver rod
A measuring tape
A wooden staff
questions.correctAnswer: A golden reed
questions.explanation: The angel who talked with John measured the city, its gates, and walls with a golden reed (Revelation 21:15).

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:16, what is true about the dimensions of the city?
options: Length, breadth, and height are equal
It is twice as long as wide
It is circular
It has no height
questions.correctAnswer: Length, breadth, and height are equal
questions.explanation: The city lies foursquare with length, breadth, and height all equal, measured twelve thousand furlongs each (Revelation 21:16).

questions.question: Which precious stone is mentioned as the first foundation of the city's wall in Revelation 21:19?
options: Jasper
Sapphire
Emerald
Amethyst
questions.correctAnswer: Jasper
questions.explanation: The first foundation of the wall of the city was jasper (Revelation 21:19).

questions.question: What was each of the twelve gates of the city made of, according to Revelation 21:21?
options: One pearl
Gold
Silver
Jasper
questions.correctAnswer: One pearl
questions.explanation: Each of the twelve gates was made of one pearl (Revelation 21:21).

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 21:22 states that the holy city contains a temple.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John saw no temple in the city because the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple (Revelation 21:22).

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 21:23, the city needs the sun and moon to shine upon it.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The city has no need of the sun or moon because the glory of God and the Lamb provide its light (Revelation 21:23).

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 21:25 says the gates of the city will be shut during the day.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The gates will not be shut at all by day because there shall be no night there (Revelation 21:25).

questions.question: Complete this verse from Revelation 21:3: 'Behold, the tabernacle of God is with _____, and he will dwell with them.'
options: men
angels
the saints
the prophets
questions.correctAnswer: men
questions.explanation: The verse states that the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them (Revelation 21:3).

questions.question: Who shall inherit all things according to Revelation 21:7?
options: He that overcometh
The faithful apostles
The kings of the earth
The angels
questions.correctAnswer: He that overcometh
questions.explanation: He that overcometh shall inherit all things; God will be his God and he shall be God's son (Revelation 21:7).

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:27, who will not enter the holy city?
options: Anything that defileth or maketh a lie
The saved nations
The twelve apostles
The kings of the earth
questions.correctAnswer: Anything that defileth or maketh a lie
questions.explanation: Nothing that defileth or works abomination or lies will enter the city, only those written in the Lamb's book of life (Revelation 21:27).

medium.title: Revelation Chapter 21 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Revelation Chapter 21 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Revelation 21, what biblical truth would you share about God's promises for the future?
options: God will wipe away all tears and there will be no more death or pain
God will allow sorrow but give strength to endure
God will delay relief until after many trials
God will call believers to suffer pain for a time
questions.correctAnswer: God will wipe away all tears and there will be no more death or pain
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:4 promises that God shall wipe away all tears; there shall be no more death, sorrow, crying, or pain. This assures believers of God's ultimate restoration and comfort. See also verses 1, 3, and 5 that emphasize the new creation and God's presence with His people.

questions.question: How does Revelation 21 teach us about the importance of faith and perseverance in the Christian life?
options: He that overcometh shall inherit all things and be called God's son
Faith is not necessary if we do good works
Only those with perfect behavior will enter heaven
Believers should rely on their own strength to overcome
questions.correctAnswer: He that overcometh shall inherit all things and be called God's son
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:7 shows that those who overcome will inherit all things and be God's children, underscoring the call to trust and persevere in faith. Verses 3, 6, and 8 further contrast the blessings for the faithful with the judgment for the unbelieving.

questions.question: A Christian friend is struggling with doubt and fear. Based on Revelation 21, what encouragement can you give about God's character?
options: God is Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, who makes all things new
God is distant and only judges
God punishes without mercy
God changes His promises frequently
questions.correctAnswer: God is Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, who makes all things new
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:6 and 21:5 affirm God's eternal nature and faithfulness in making all things new. This encourages believers to trust God's unchanging promises. See also verses 3 and 4 about God's presence and comfort.

questions.question: How does Revelation 21 emphasize the value of holiness and integrity in the Christian walk?
options: Nothing defiling or deceitful will enter the holy city
Sin is tolerated if done in secret
Believers can enter regardless of lifestyle
Only big sins matter, not small ones
questions.correctAnswer: Nothing defiling or deceitful will enter the holy city
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:27 states that nothing defiling, abominable, or lying will enter the holy city, highlighting the call to holiness and truthfulness. Verses 8 and 27 underscore the difference between the faithful and those who practice sin.

questions.question: A believer is unsure about the importance of God's presence. Based on Revelation 21, what would you say about living in fellowship with God?
options: God will dwell with His people and be their God
God is far and does not dwell with humans
God only visits occasionally
God's presence is only in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: God will dwell with His people and be their God
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:3 assures that the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them as their God. This shows the intimate fellowship believers can enjoy. See also verse 22 about God and the Lamb being the temple.

questions.question: How does the description of the new Jerusalem in Revelation 21 encourage believers to live with hope and purity?
options: The city is pure gold, clear as glass, and has gates of pearl
The city is hidden and dark
The city is guarded and closed to most
The city tolerates impurity
questions.correctAnswer: The city is pure gold, clear as glass, and has gates of pearl
questions.explanation: Verses 18 and 21 describe the city as pure gold like clear glass with gates of pearl, symbolizing purity and beauty. This encourages believers to strive for purity and holiness. See also verses 11 and 19-20 about precious stones and glory.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with feelings of rejection. What truth from Revelation 21 can you share about being God's child?
options: He that overcometh shall be called God's son
Only some are chosen without conditions
Believers must earn God's sonship by works
Sonship is only a metaphor
questions.correctAnswer: He that overcometh shall be called God's son
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:7 promises those who overcome will be God's sons, affirming their identity and acceptance. This is supported by verses 3 and 6 which stress God's presence and provision.

questions.question: How does Revelation 21 teach about the importance of truthfulness and honesty in the believer's life?
options: All liars will have their part in the lake of fire
Truthfulness is optional for salvation
Lies are forgiven without repentance
Honesty is not emphasized
questions.correctAnswer: All liars will have their part in the lake of fire
questions.explanation: Verse 8 warns that all liars will share in the second death, indicating the serious consequences of dishonesty. Verse 27 also excludes those who make lies from entering the holy city.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 21, the new heaven and new earth will have no sea.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:1 states that in the new heaven and new earth, the first heaven and earth have passed away and there is no more sea, symbolizing the complete renewal and removal of chaos.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 21 teaches that the glory of God and the Lamb will be the light of the new Jerusalem, removing the need for sun or moon.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 23 clearly states the city has no need for sun or moon because the glory of God and the Lamb provide the light, symbolizing God's presence as the ultimate source of illumination and life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Revelation 21 describes the new Jerusalem as lying ________, with length, breadth, and height equal.
options: foursquare
circular
triangular
irregular
questions.correctAnswer: foursquare
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:16 describes the city as lying foursquare, meaning it is perfectly shaped with equal length, breadth, and height, symbolizing completeness and perfection.

questions.question: How does Revelation 21 encourage believers to rely on God's provision in times of spiritual thirst?
options: God freely gives the water of life to those who thirst
Believers must earn water through good deeds
Water of life is only for a select few
Spiritual thirst is not addressed
questions.correctAnswer: God freely gives the water of life to those who thirst
questions.explanation: Verse 6 shows God offering the water of life freely to those who thirst, symbolizing His grace and provision for spiritual needs. This encourages believers to depend on His generosity.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about the final judgment. What does Revelation 21 teach about those who are excluded from the new Jerusalem?
options: Those who practice fear, unbelief, abominations, and lies will face the second death
All will eventually enter the city regardless of deeds
Only those who never sin are excluded
Exclusion is temporary
questions.correctAnswer: Those who practice fear, unbelief, abominations, and lies will face the second death
questions.explanation: Verse 8 lists those excluded—fearful, unbelieving, abominable, and liars—who will have their part in the lake of fire, the second death. This teaches about the seriousness of sin and the call to faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Revelation 21 illustrate the relationship between the church and Christ using the imagery of marriage?
options: The holy city is described as a bride adorned for her husband
The city is described as a fortress
The city is described as a marketplace
The city is described as a temple only
questions.correctAnswer: The holy city is described as a bride adorned for her husband
questions.explanation: Verse 2 and 9 refer to the new Jerusalem as the bride, the Lamb's wife, emphasizing the intimate, covenantal relationship between Christ and His church.

questions.question: How does Revelation 21 encourage believers to live with generosity and stewardship?
options: Kings bring their glory and honor into the city, symbolizing giving to God's kingdom
Believers should hoard riches
Material wealth is unimportant
Only personal gain matters
questions.correctAnswer: Kings bring their glory and honor into the city, symbolizing giving to God's kingdom
questions.explanation: Verses 24 and 26 mention the kings of the earth bringing glory and honor into the city, symbolizing the offering of one's best to God, encouraging generosity and stewardship.

hard.title: Revelation Chapter 21 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Revelation Chapter 21.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'new heaven and new earth' mentioned in Revelation 21:1 in relation to Isaiah 65:17?
options: They represent a restored creation free from former corruption
They symbolize a temporary state before final judgment
They are purely metaphorical with no physical reality
They refer to the existing cosmos renewed by fire
questions.correctAnswer: They represent a restored creation free from former corruption
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:1 echoes Isaiah 65:17, both describing a new creation where former things have passed away, indicating a restoration and renewal rather than mere destruction or metaphor.

questions.question: In Revelation 21:2, the 'new Jerusalem' is described as a bride. What Old Testament imagery does this typology recall?
options: The covenant relationship between God and Israel as a bride in Hosea
The building of Solomon's temple as a place of worship
The Exodus journey as a wilderness bride
The Davidic kingship portrayed as a bridegroom
questions.correctAnswer: The covenant relationship between God and Israel as a bride in Hosea
questions.explanation: The depiction of the new Jerusalem as a bride in Revelation 21:2 recalls Hosea's portrayal of Israel as God's unfaithful bride, highlighting the restoration of the covenant relationship.

questions.question: Which literary device is primarily used in Revelation 21:3 when it states 'the tabernacle of God is with men'?
options: Metaphor illustrating God's dwelling among humanity
Simile comparing the tabernacle to a temple
Hyperbole emphasizing God’s holiness
Allegory for the church
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor illustrating God's dwelling among humanity
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:3 uses metaphor to convey that God’s presence will dwell directly with humanity, reminiscent of the tabernacle’s role in the Old Testament as God's dwelling place.

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:4, what are the 'former things' that have passed away?
options: Death, sorrow, crying, and pain
Sin, law, and judgment
Night, darkness, and chaos
War, famine, and pestilence
questions.correctAnswer: Death, sorrow, crying, and pain
questions.explanation: Verse 21:4 explicitly states that death, sorrow, crying, and pain are the former things that have passed away in the new creation.

questions.question: In Revelation 21:5, what does the phrase 'I make all things new' reflect in biblical theology?
options: God’s sovereign ability to renew creation and fulfill promises
A call to moral reform among believers
An allegory for spiritual enlightenment
A historical statement about Israel’s return from exile
questions.correctAnswer: God’s sovereign ability to renew creation and fulfill promises
questions.explanation: The declaration 'I make all things new' in 21:5 highlights God's sovereign power to renew creation and bring about the fulfillment of divine promises, connecting to themes in Isaiah and Ezekiel.

questions.question: The title 'Alpha and Omega' in Revelation 21:6 signifies what theological concept?
options: God as the eternal beginning and end of all things
Jesus as the mediator between God and man
The Holy Spirit’s presence in creation
The cyclical nature of history
questions.correctAnswer: God as the eternal beginning and end of all things
questions.explanation: Alpha and Omega, the first and last letters of the Greek alphabet, symbolize God's eternality and sovereignty as the beginning and end, affirmed in 21:6.

questions.question: Who 'shall inherit all things' according to Revelation 21:7, and what is the nature of this inheritance?
options: He that overcometh; receiving God as his God and becoming His son
The faithful synagogue; ruling over earthly kingdoms
The priests; reigning in the restored temple
The prophets; possessing the knowledge of God
questions.correctAnswer: He that overcometh; receiving God as his God and becoming His son
questions.explanation: Verse 21:7 promises inheritance of all things to those who overcome, emphasizing the relational blessing of being God's children.

questions.question: Revelation 21:8 lists groups who face the 'second death.' Which group is NOT mentioned in this verse?
options: The humble
The fearful
The abominable
The liars
questions.correctAnswer: The humble
questions.explanation: The verse 21:8 lists fearful, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, whoremongers, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars, but does not mention the humble.

questions.question: What is the symbolic meaning of the 'twelve gates' and 'twelve angels' in Revelation 21:12?
options: Representation of the twelve tribes of Israel and divine protection
Twelve apostles guarding the church against evil
Twelve nations under God’s judgment
Twelve months of the year symbolizing completeness
questions.correctAnswer: Representation of the twelve tribes of Israel and divine protection
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:12 explicitly connects the twelve gates to the twelve tribes of Israel, with angels signifying God's protective presence.

questions.question: How does the measurement of the city in Revelation 21:16 reflect ancient Near Eastern architectural symbolism?
options: The perfect cubical shape symbolizes divine perfection and completeness
It imitates Babylonian city walls to represent human pride
The measurements indicate a temporary encampment
It reflects the dimensions of Solomon’s temple
questions.correctAnswer: The perfect cubical shape symbolizes divine perfection and completeness
questions.explanation: The equal length, breadth, and height of the city in 21:16 represent the biblical symbol of perfection and completeness, similar to the New Jerusalem as a holy, perfect city.

questions.question: What is the significance of the wall being made of jasper and the city being like pure gold as described in Revelation 21:18?
options: They signify purity, glory, and the preciousness of God’s eternal dwelling
They represent the wealth accumulated by ancient Jerusalem
They imply fragility and transparency of spiritual reality
They symbolize the exile and diaspora of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They signify purity, glory, and the preciousness of God’s eternal dwelling
questions.explanation: Verse 21:18 uses jasper and gold imagery to convey the holiness, glory, and precious nature of the New Jerusalem as God's eternal home.

questions.question: Which Old Testament tradition is echoed in Revelation 21:14 by the mention of the twelve foundations named after the twelve apostles?
options: The foundation stones of the priestly breastplate in Exodus
The twelve stones of the Jordan crossing in Joshua
The twelve tribes’ encampment in Numbers
The twelve sons of Jacob’s tombs in Genesis
questions.correctAnswer: The foundation stones of the priestly breastplate in Exodus
questions.explanation: The twelve foundations named after apostles in 21:14 allude to the twelve stones on the high priest's breastplate (Exodus 28), linking priestly mediation to the foundation of the church.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 21:22 states that there is a temple in the New Jerusalem because it is central to God's presence.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 21:22 explicitly states there is no temple in the city because God Almighty and the Lamb themselves are its temple, indicating direct divine presence without a physical building.

questions.question: What does Revelation 21:23 reveal about the source of light in the New Jerusalem?
options: The glory of God and the Lamb replaces the sun and moon
The city is lit by lamps made of precious stones
The sun and moon shine brighter than ever
Fire from the altar provides light
questions.correctAnswer: The glory of God and the Lamb replaces the sun and moon
questions.explanation: Verse 21:23 explains the city has no need for sun or moon because God’s glory and the Lamb provide its light, symbolizing divine presence as ultimate illumination.

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:27, who is excluded from entering the New Jerusalem?
options: Those who defile, commit abominations, or lie, and are not written in the Lamb’s book of life
Only the Gentiles who do not worship God
The poor and marginalized
Those who do not follow Mosaic Law
questions.correctAnswer: Those who defile, commit abominations, or lie, and are not written in the Lamb’s book of life
questions.explanation: Verse 21:27 states that nothing impure or deceitful can enter the city, only those whose names are written in the Lamb’s book of life.

theological.title: Revelation Chapter 21 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Revelation Chapter 21 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:3, what significant relationship is established between God and humanity in the new creation?
options: God will dwell with them and be their God
Humans will ascend to heaven to live with God
God will judge all nations immediately
Humans will become angels
questions.correctAnswer: God will dwell with them and be their God
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:3 states that the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them; they shall be His people, and God Himself shall be with them and be their God. This reflects the intimate fellowship between God and redeemed humanity as prophesied in Ezekiel 37:27, John 1:14, 2 Corinthians 6:16, and Hebrews 8:10.

questions.question: What does Revelation 21:4 say about the conditions of suffering in the new heaven and earth?
options: There will be no more death, sorrow, crying, or pain
Some suffering remains but is greatly reduced
Only death will be abolished, but sorrow remains
Pain will continue as a reminder of sin
questions.correctAnswer: There will be no more death, sorrow, crying, or pain
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:4 clearly promises that God will wipe away all tears and there will be no more death, sorrow, crying, or pain, as the former things have passed away. This fulfills Isaiah 25:8, 1 Corinthians 15:26, Romans 8:18, and 2 Corinthians 4:17, which speak of the final abolition of suffering and death.

questions.question: In Revelation 21:6, who is identified as Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end?
options: The One sitting on the throne, God
John the Apostle
The angel with the seven vials
Moses
questions.correctAnswer: The One sitting on the throne, God
questions.explanation: The text identifies the speaker as Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, which is a title for God, often applied to Christ (Revelation 1:8; Isaiah 44:6; John 1:1-3; Hebrews 1:10-12), emphasizing God's eternal nature and sovereignty over all history.

questions.question: What inheritance is promised to 'he that overcometh' according to Revelation 21:7?
options: All things and the status of being God's son
Wealth and earthly kingdoms
Exemption from judgment
A temporary reward before the millennium
questions.correctAnswer: All things and the status of being God's son
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:7 promises that the one who overcomes shall inherit all things and God will be their God, and they shall be His son. This echoes promises in Romans 8:17, Galatians 3:29, and John 1:12 about the believer's status as children of God and heirs with Christ.

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:8, which of the following is NOT mentioned as having their part in the lake of fire?
options: The fearful
The faithful
Murderers
Sorcerers
questions.correctAnswer: The faithful
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:8 lists the fearful, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, whoremongers, sorcerers, idolaters, and liars as those who will have their part in the lake of fire, which is the second death. The faithful, by contrast, are promised eternal life (Hebrews 10:38; Matthew 25:46; 2 Thessalonians 1:9).

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'new Jerusalem' described in Revelation 21:2?
options: It symbolizes the redeemed community prepared as a bride for Christ
It is a literal city built by angels
It is a temporary dwelling place for believers
It represents the old covenant
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes the redeemed community prepared as a bride for Christ
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:2 portrays the new Jerusalem coming down from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband, symbolizing the redeemed people of God united with Christ. This aligns with Ephesians 5:25-27, 2 Corinthians 11:2, Isaiah 62:5, and John 3:29 where the church is presented as the bride of Christ.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the absence of a temple in the new Jerusalem as stated in Revelation 21:22?
options: The Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are the temple
Worship is abolished in the new creation
The temple is hidden but still exists
Angels replace the temple as worship centers
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are the temple
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:22 indicates no temple is found because God and the Lamb themselves are the temple, signifying direct access to God's presence without mediation. This is consistent with John 4:21-24, Ezekiel 37:27, Hebrews 10:19-22, and 1 Corinthians 3:16 emphasizing God's indwelling presence.

questions.question: How is the new Jerusalem illuminated according to Revelation 21:23?
options: By the glory of God and the Lamb as its light
By the sun and the moon
By eternal fire lamps
By the stars of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: By the glory of God and the Lamb as its light
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:23 states that the city needs no sun or moon because the glory of God and the Lamb provide its light. This reflects God's presence as the ultimate source of light (Isaiah 60:19-20; John 8:12; Psalm 27:1; 2 Corinthians 4:6).

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:12-14, what do the twelve gates and twelve foundations of the new Jerusalem represent?
options: The twelve tribes of Israel and the twelve apostles of the Lamb
The twelve patriarchs and twelve kings of Israel
The twelve prophets and twelve judges of Israel
The twelve tribes of Israel only
questions.correctAnswer: The twelve tribes of Israel and the twelve apostles of the Lamb
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:12-14 describes the twelve gates named after the twelve tribes of Israel and the twelve foundations named after the twelve apostles of the Lamb, symbolizing the continuity of God's covenant people across both Old and New Covenants (Ephesians 2:19-20, Galatians 3:29, Matthew 19:28, and 1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: What does the measurement of the new Jerusalem in Revelation 21:16 symbolize about its perfection?
options: Its length, breadth, and height are equal, indicating completeness
It is a small city for a few people
It is irregular and complex
It is measured by human standards only
questions.correctAnswer: Its length, breadth, and height are equal, indicating completeness
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:16 states the city is laid out as a square with equal length, breadth, and height, symbolizing divine perfection, completeness, and stability. This imagery recalls Ezekiel 40:5, 2 Chronicles 3:4, and the perfect holiness of God’s dwelling.

questions.question: What does Revelation 21:21 reveal about the gates of the new Jerusalem?
options: Each gate is made of a single pearl
The gates are made of iron
The gates are closed permanently
The gates are guarded by lions
questions.correctAnswer: Each gate is made of a single pearl
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:21 describes the twelve gates as twelve pearls, each gate a single pearl, symbolizing great value and purity. This portrays the preciousness of the city’s access points, consistent with Matthew 13:45-46 and Isaiah 54:11-12.

questions.question: What is the significance of the statement in Revelation 21:25 that the gates shall not be shut by day?
options: There will be no night in the new creation, indicating continual access and security
The city is always vulnerable to enemies
The gates are kept open only during festivals
The gates are symbolic of human freedom only
questions.correctAnswer: There will be no night in the new creation, indicating continual access and security
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:25 reveals that the gates will never be shut because there is no night, symbolizing perpetual light, security, and open fellowship. This aligns with Isaiah 60:18, Psalm 121:3-4, and John 10:27-28.

questions.question: According to Revelation 21:27, who is excluded from entering the new Jerusalem?
options: Those who defile, practice abomination, or lie
Everyone except the apostles
Only the unbelieving nations
Those who have not observed the law
questions.correctAnswer: Those who defile, practice abomination, or lie
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:27 states that nothing impure, abominable, or deceitful will enter the city, but only those whose names are written in the Lamb’s book of life. This reflects God's holiness and justice consistent with Exodus 34:7, Psalm 15:1-5, and 1 John 3:3.

questions.question: What does the fountain of the water of life in Revelation 21:6 symbolize?
options: Eternal life offered freely to the thirsty
A literal spring in the city
Water for agricultural purposes
A symbol of judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Eternal life offered freely to the thirsty
questions.explanation: Revelation 21:6 promises the water of life freely to those who thirst, symbolizing the gift of eternal life through Christ. This is echoed in John 4:14, Isaiah 55:1, Ezekiel 47:1-12, and John 7:37-38.

questions.question: What is the significance of the precious stones in the foundations of the new Jerusalem described in Revelation 21:19-20?
options: They signify the glory, beauty, and foundation of the church
They are magical stones with protective powers
They represent earthly wealth
They are purely ornamental with no symbolism
questions.correctAnswer: They signify the glory, beauty, and foundation of the church
questions.explanation: The precious stones in the city’s foundations represent the glory and beauty of God's people and the apostles as the church’s foundation, consistent with Exodus 28:17-20, 1 Corinthians 3:11, Isaiah 54:11-12, and Ephesians 2:20.
